t: To the chief Musician upon Sheminith, A Psalm of David.
Help,*p Lord;*s for the godly man ceaseth; for the faithful fail from among the children of men.
They*p speak vanity every one with his neighbour: with flattering lips and with a double heart do they speak.
The*p Lord*s shall cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things:
Who*p have said, With our tongue will we prevail; our lips are our own: who is lord over us?
For*p the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, saith the Lord;*s I will set him in safety from him that puffeth at him.
The*p words of the Lord*s are pure words: as silver tried in a furnace of earth, purified seven times.
Thou*p shalt keep them, O Lord,*s thou shalt preserve them from this generation for ever.
The*p wicked walk on every side, when the vilest men are exalted.
